metadata.title: CVE-2019-5747 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in BusyBox through 1.30.0. An out of bounds read inudhcp components (consumed by the DHCP client, server, and/or relay) mightallow a remote attacker to leak sensitive information from the stack bysending a crafted DHCP message. This is related to assurance of a 4-bytelength when decoding DHCP_SUBNET. NOTE: this issue exists because of anincomplete fix for CVE-2018-20679.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5747` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

busybox - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.2
busybox-initramfs - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.2
busybox-static - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.2
busybox-syslogd - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.2
udhcpc - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.2
udhcpd - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: busybox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.2').
